    <h2 id="autogen.cache.cosmos_db_cache.CosmosDBCache" class="doc doc-heading">
        <code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-class"></code>
        <span class="doc doc-object-name doc-class-name">CosmosDBCache</span>
        <a href="#autogen.cache.cosmos_db_cache.CosmosDBCache" class="headerlink" title="Permanent link"></a>
    </h2>

```python
CosmosDBCache(seed: str | int, cosmosdb_config: autogen.cache.cosmos_db_cache.CosmosDBConfig)
```

    Synchronous implementation of AbstractCache using Azure Cosmos DB NoSQL API.
    
    This class provides a concrete implementation of the AbstractCache
    interface using Azure Cosmos DB for caching data, with synchronous operations.
    
    Attributes:
        seed (Union[str, int]): A seed or namespace used as a partition key.
        client (CosmosClient): The Cosmos DB client used for caching.
        container: The container instance used for caching.
    
    Initialize the CosmosDBCache instance.

<b>Parameters:</b>
| Name | Description |
|--|--|
| `seed` | A seed or namespace for the cache, used as a partition key.<br/><br/>**Type:** `str \| int` |
| `cosmosdb_config` | **Type:** `autogen.cache.cosmos_db_cache.CosmosDBConfig` |

### Static Methods

<code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-method"></code>
#### create_cache
<a href="#autogen.cache.cosmos_db_cache.CosmosDBCache.create_cache" class="headerlink" title="Permanent link"></a>

```python
create_cache(seed: str | int, cosmosdb_config: autogen.cache.cosmos_db_cache.CosmosDBConfig) -> 
```

    Factory method to create a CosmosDBCache instance based on the provided configuration.
    This method decides whether to use an existing CosmosClient or create a new one.

<b>Parameters:</b>
| Name | Description |
|--|--|
| `seed` | **Type:** `str \| int` |
| `cosmosdb_config` | **Type:** `autogen.cache.cosmos_db_cache.CosmosDBConfig` |

### Instance Methods

<code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-method"></code>
#### close
<a href="#autogen.cache.cosmos_db_cache.CosmosDBCache.close" class="headerlink" title="Permanent link"></a>

```python
close(self) -> None
```

    Close the Cosmos DB client.
    
    Perform any necessary cleanup, such as closing network connections.

<br />

<code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-method"></code>
#### get
<a href="#autogen.cache.cosmos_db_cache.CosmosDBCache.get" class="headerlink" title="Permanent link"></a>

```python
get(
    self,
    key: str,
    default: Any | None = None
) -> Any | None
```

    Retrieve an item from the Cosmos DB cache.

<b>Parameters:</b>
| Name | Description |
|--|--|
| `key` | The key identifying the item in the cache.<br/><br/>**Type:** `str` |
| `default` | The default value to return if the key is not found.<br/><br/>**Type:** `Any \| None`<br/><br/>**Default:** None |

<b>Returns:</b>
| Type | Description |
|--|--|
| `Any \| None` | The deserialized value associated with the key if found, else the default value. |

<br />

<code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-method"></code>
#### set
<a href="#autogen.cache.cosmos_db_cache.CosmosDBCache.set" class="headerlink" title="Permanent link"></a>

```python
set(
    self,
    key: str,
    value: Any
) -> None
```

    Set an item in the Cosmos DB cache.

<b>Parameters:</b>
| Name | Description |
|--|--|
| `key` | The key under which the item is to be stored.<br/><br/>**Type:** `str` |
| `value` | The value to be stored in the cache.<br/><br/>**Type:** `Any` |

    <h2 id="autogen.cache.cosmos_db_cache.CosmosDBConfig" class="doc doc-heading">
        <code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-class"></code>
        <span class="doc doc-object-name doc-class-name">CosmosDBConfig</span>
        <a href="#autogen.cache.cosmos_db_cache.CosmosDBConfig" class="headerlink" title="Permanent link"></a>
    </h2>

```python
CosmosDBConfig(*args, **kwargs)
```

    dict() -> new empty dictionary
    dict(mapping) -> new dictionary initialized from a mapping object's
        (key, value) pairs
    dict(iterable) -> new dictionary initialized as if via:
        d = \{}
        for k, v in iterable:
            d[k] = v
    dict(**kwargs) -> new dictionary initialized with the name=value pairs
        in the keyword argument list.  For example:  dict(one=1, two=2)

<b>Parameters:</b>
| Name | Description |
|--|--|
| `*args` |  |
| `**kwargs` |  |
